TEXT.English: Hello! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.French: Hello! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Herrscher von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Ich erwarte viele Jahre gute Beziehungen zwischen [OUR_EMPIRE] und [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Italian: Hello! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Spanish: Hello! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!

TEXT.English: Welcome to [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace or demand war?
TEXT.French: Welcome to [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace or demand war?
TEXT.German: Willkommen in [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME]. Ich bin [OUR_NAME]! Haltet ihr nach Frieden ausschau oder verlangt ihr Krieg?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace or demand war?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace or demand war?

TEXT.English: Welcome to this beautiful land, [CT_NAME]. Take a look around and see the might of the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.French: Welcome to this beautiful land, [CT_NAME]. Take a look around and see the might of the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.German: Willkommen in diesem wunderschönen Land, [CT_NAME]. Schaut euch um und erkennt die Macht von [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to this beautiful land, [CT_NAME]. Take a look around and see the might of the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to this beautiful land, [CT_NAME]. Take a look around and see the might of the [OUR_EMPIRE]!

TEXT.English: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! I hope you come in peace... it would be so unfortunate if we had to destroy you!
TEXT.French: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! I hope you come in peace... it would be so unfortunate if we had to destroy you!
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, ich bin [OUR_NAME], Herrscher von [OUR_EMPIRE]! Ich hoffe ihr kommt in Frieden... es wäre bedauernswert wenn wir euch zerstören müssten!
TEXT.Italian: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! I hope you come in peace... it would be so unfortunate if we had to destroy you!
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! I hope you come in peace... it would be so unfortunate if we had to destroy you!

TEXT.English: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.French: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.German: Ich fühle mich geehrt euch zu begegnen, [CT_NAME]. Ich bin [OUR_NAME] vom [OUR_CIV_ADJ] Volk. Wir können Freund oder Feind sein.
TEXT.Italian: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.Spanish: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people. We can be friends or enemies.

TEXT.English: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.French: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.German: Willkommen in der Wüste. Ich bin Abu Yusuf Yagub. Wir können Freund oder Feind sein.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.Portuguese: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.

TEXT.English: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.French: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.German: Derweil andere Nationen Krieg führen, heiraten wir Österreicher.
TEXT.Italian: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.Spanish: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.Portuguese: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.

TEXT.English: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.French: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.German: Willkommen an meinem Hof. Schnappt euch ein Getränk und schaut euch um. Wenn wir Freunde sind, werdet ihr vielleicht solange regieren wie ich.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.Portuguese: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.

TEXT.English: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.French: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt mein Freund. Was sollen wir heute erobern?
TEXT.Italian: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.Spanish: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.Portuguese: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?

TEXT.English: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.French: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.German: Ich bin Maximilian. Das Aufzählen meiner Titel würde den ganzen Tag dauern, lasst uns stattdessen eine Tjost abhalten.
TEXT.Italian: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.Spanish: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.Portuguese: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.

TEXT.English: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.French: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.German: Durch die Gnade des Herrn führte ich die bulgarische Nation zur Höhe des Ruhmes. Erzählt mir über euch.
TEXT.Italian: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.Spanish: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.Portuguese: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.

TEXT.English: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.French: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.German: Ah, fantastisch, ein neuer Feind zum Zerquetschen! Vielleicht habt ihr von mir gehört, Philip der Kühne? Nein... nun gut, das hättet ihr wohl besser.
TEXT.Italian: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.Portuguese: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.

TEXT.English: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.French: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.German: Ich habe nun über 50 Jahre in Sieg oder Frieden regiert; geliebt von meinem Volk, gefürchtet von meinen Feinden und von meinen Verbündeten respektiert. Oh Mann, setzt nicht euer Vertrauen auf diese Welt.
TEXT.Italian: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.Spanish: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.Portuguese: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!

TEXT.English: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.French: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.German: Ich bin Simone Boccanegra, erster Doge von Genua. Ihr könnt nicht zufällig singen?
TEXT.Italian: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.Spanish: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.Portuguese: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?

TEXT.English: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.French: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.German: Wisst ihr, ich weiß worauf ihr hinaus wollt.
TEXT.Italian: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.Spanish: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.Portuguese: I can see what you're up to, you know.

TEXT.English: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?
TEXT.French: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?
TEXT.German: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?
TEXT.Portuguese: Greetings, pan! I, [OUR_NAME], Ataman of the Zaporozhian army! What are you looking for on the green steppes of Ukraine?

TEXT.English: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.French: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.German: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Willkommen, mein Kind.
TEXT.Italian: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.Spanish: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.Portuguese: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.

TEXT.English: Welcome to my dominions, [CT_NAME]. My empire is vast, as is my knowlege. Would you agree to peaceful terms, or shall I bring forth my armies against you, in the name of God?
TEXT.French: Welcome to my dominions, [CT_NAME]. My empire is vast, as is my knowlege. Would you agree to peaceful terms, or shall I bring forth my armies against you, in the name of God?
TEXT.German: Willkommen in meinem Machtgebiet, [CT_NAME]. Mein Reich ist gewaltig, wie auch mein Wissen. Wollt ihr einem friedlichen Abkommen zustimmen oder soll ich meine Heere im Namen des Herrn gegen euch aufstellen?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to my dominions, [CT_NAME]. My empire is vast, as is my knowlege. Would you agree to peaceful terms, or shall I bring forth my armies against you, in the name of God?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to my dominions, [CT_NAME]. My empire is vast, as is my knowlege. Would you agree to peaceful terms, or shall I bring forth my armies against you, in the name of God?

TEXT.English: It is impiety, and almost blasphemy to presume to know the will of God. It comes from the sin of pride. Even kings, [CT_NAME], must submit to being used by God's will without knowing what it is. They must never seek to use it.
TEXT.French: It is impiety, and almost blasphemy to presume to know the will of God. It comes from the sin of pride. Even kings, [CT_NAME], must submit to being used by God's will without knowing what it is. They must never seek to use it.
TEXT.German: Es ist gottlos und fast Gotteslästerung sich anzumaßen den Willen Gottes zu kennen. Das kommt von der Sünde des Hochmutes. Selbst Könige, [CT_NAME], müssen sich Gottes Willen fügen ohne zu wissen was das ist. Sie dürfen niemals danach streben ihn zu missbrauchen.
TEXT.Italian: It is impiety, and almost blasphemy to presume to know the will of God. It comes from the sin of pride. Even kings, [CT_NAME], must submit to being used by God's will without knowing what it is. They must never seek to use it.
TEXT.Spanish: It is impiety, and almost blasphemy to presume to know the will of God. It comes from the sin of pride. Even kings, [CT_NAME], must submit to being used by God's will without knowing what it is. They must never seek to use it.

TEXT.English: Hello! I am [OUR_NAME], king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I hope you come with peace... it would be so unfortunate if we had to destroy you!
TEXT.French: Les [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] vous souhaitent la bienvenue. J'espère que nous connaitrons une paix durable. Et vous ?
TEXT.German: Das [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk heißt Euch willkommen. Ich freue mich auf eine lange Zeit des Friedens zwischen uns. Was sagt Ihr dazu?
TEXT.Italian: Il popolo della civiltà [OUR_CIV_ADJ] ti dà il benvenuto. Non vedo l'ora che ci sia tra di noi una pace duratura. Cosa rispondi?
TEXT.Spanish: El pueblo [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] os da la bienvenida. Espero que haya una paz duradera entre ambos. ¿Y vos?

TEXT.English: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.French: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.German: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.Italian: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.Spanish: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.

TEXT.English: Speak of the devil and the devil appears... begone, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.French: Speak of the devil and the devil appears... begone, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Wenn man vom Teufel spricht, da erscheint er ... Hinfort [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Italian: Speak of the devil and the devil appears... begone, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Spanish: Speak of the devil and the devil appears... begone, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: Peace? Not impossible, but right now very improbable, [CT_NAME]. You still need to be taught a lesson!
TEXT.French: Peace? Not impossible, but right now very improbable, [CT_NAME]. You still need to be taught a lesson!
TEXT.German: Frieden? Nicht unmöglich, aber sehr unwahrscheinlich, [CT_NAME]. Ich werde euch eine Lektion erteilen!
TEXT.Italian: Peace? Not impossible, but right now very improbable, [CT_NAME]. You still need to be taught a lesson!
TEXT.Spanish: Peace? Not impossible, but right now very improbable, [CT_NAME]. You still need to be taught a lesson!

TEXT.English: Good, good, [CT_NAME], I am glad you have come. Let us discuss our visions of glorious imperialism and colonization of the world!
TEXT.French: Good, good, [CT_NAME], I am glad you have come. Let us discuss our visions of glorious imperialism and colonization of the world!
TEXT.German: Gut, gut, [CT_NAME], I bin froh, dass ihr gekommen seid. Lasst uns über unsere Vision eines glorreichen Imperiums und der Kolonisation der Welt nachdenken!
TEXT.Italian: Good, good, [CT_NAME], I am glad you have come. Let us discuss our visions of glorious imperialism and colonization of the world!
TEXT.Spanish: Good, good, [CT_NAME], I am glad you have come. Let us discuss our visions of glorious imperialism and colonization of the world!

TEXT.English: Time is money, [CT_NAME], and you're apparently wasting my time.
TEXT.French: Time is money, [CT_NAME], and you're apparently wasting my time.
TEXT.German: Zeit ist Geld, [CT_NAME], und ihr verschwendet gerade meine Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: Time is money, [CT_NAME], and you're apparently wasting my time.
TEXT.Spanish: Time is money, [CT_NAME], and you're apparently wasting my time.

TEXT.English: The humble realm of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] have but one small request. I am quite sure you can handle it.
TEXT.French: The humble realm of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] have but one small request. I am quite sure you can handle it.
TEXT.German: Das ärmliche Reich von [OUR_CIV_SHORT] hat nur ein kleines Anliegen. Ich bin sicher, ihr seid so gütig.
TEXT.Italian: The humble realm of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] have but one small request. I am quite sure you can handle it.
TEXT.Spanish: The humble realm of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] have but one small request. I am quite sure you can handle it.

TEXT.English: In times of need, kindness can be very valuable.
TEXT.French: In times of need, kindness can be very valuable.
TEXT.German: In Zeiten des Nots kann Güte sehr wertvoll sein.
TEXT.Italian: In times of need, kindness can be very valuable.
TEXT.Spanish: In times of need, kindness can be very valuable.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], it has been brought to my attention that you have something the [OUR_EMPIRE] needs. I am sure you are willing to help us here, or else I will send my armada - and mark my words, it will not fail this time!
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], it has been brought to my attention that you have something the [OUR_EMPIRE] needs. I am sure you are willing to help us here, or else I will send my armada - and mark my words, it will not fail this time!
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], es wurde mir zugetragen ihr habt etwas von Wert für [OUR_EMPIRE]. Ich bin sicher, ihr seid geneigt uns zu helfen, oder anderfalls werde ich meine Armada schicken. Hört auf meine Worte, ich werde dieses Mal nicht versagen.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], it has been brought to my attention that you have something the [OUR_EMPIRE] needs. I am sure you are willing to help us here, or else I will send my armada - and mark my words, it will not fail this time!
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], it has been brought to my attention that you have something the [OUR_EMPIRE] needs. I am sure you are willing to help us here, or else I will send my armada - and mark my words, it will not fail this time!

TEXT.English: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.French: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.German: Alles was wir haben ist ein Leben und wir leben es so wie wir glauben es leben zu müssen. Zu Opfern was man ist und ohne Glauben zu leben, dieses Schicksal ist schlimmer als zu Sterben.
TEXT.Italian: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.Spanish: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.

TEXT.English: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], the Messenger of God. Choose your words carefully, for it is said that people are hanged sometimes for speaking the truth.
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], the Messenger of God. Choose your words carefully, for it is said that people are hanged sometimes for speaking the truth.
TEXT.German: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. Ich bin [OUR_NAME], der Bote Gottes. Wählt eure Worte sorgsam, man erzählt, dass Leute schon gehängt wurden nur weil sie die Wahrheit sagten.
TEXT.Italian: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], the Messenger of God. Choose your words carefully, for it is said that people are hanged sometimes for speaking the truth.
TEXT.Spanish: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. Soy [OUR_NAME], mensajera de Dios. Escoged vuestras palabras con cuidado, pues se dice que a veces se ahorca a la gente por decir la verdad.

TEXT.English: I'm talking to the Lord right now. Don't interrupt me!
TEXT.French: I'm talking to the Lord right now. Don't interrupt me!
TEXT.German: Ich spreche gerade mit dem Herrn. Unterbrecht mich nicht!
TEXT.Italian: I'm talking to the Lord right now. Don't interrupt me!
TEXT.Spanish: Estoy hablando ahora mismo con el Seor. No me interrumpis!

TEXT.English: You'll have to burn me at the stake first.
TEXT.French: You'll have to burn me at the stake first.
TEXT.German: Ihr müsst mich zuerst auf dem Scheiterhaufen verbrennen.
TEXT.Italian: You'll have to burn me at the stake first.
TEXT.Spanish: Primero tendris que quemarme en la estaca.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], I had a vision that you'd arrive here! Come and make yourself comfortable.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], I had a vision that you'd arrive here! Come and make yourself comfortable.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], ich hatte die Vision dass ihr ankommen werdet! Kommt und macht es euch bequem.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], I had a vision that you'd arrive here! Come and make yourself comfortable.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], tuve una visin de que vos llegarais! Venid y tomad asiento.

TEXT.English: Come out, [CT_NAME], so I can send you to hell!
TEXT.French: Come out, [CT_NAME], so I can send you to hell!
TEXT.German: Kommt heraus, [CT_NAME], damit ich euch zur Hölle schicken kann!
TEXT.Italian: Come out, [CT_NAME], so I can send you to hell!
TEXT.Spanish: Salid, [CT_NAME], para que os pueda mandar al infierno!

TEXT.English: God told me that you should hand this over. That is all.
TEXT.French: God told me that you should hand this over. That is all.
TEXT.German: Gott enthüllte mir dass ihr das übergeben sollt. Das ist alles.
TEXT.Italian: God told me that you should hand this over. That is all.
TEXT.Spanish: Dios me ha dicho que debis entregarnoslo. Eso es todo.

TEXT.English: I know nothing about the love or hatred that God has for you, [CT_NAME], but I do know that you will all die if you don't hand this over to [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.French: I know nothing about the love or hatred that God has for you, [CT_NAME], but I do know that you will all die if you don't hand this over to [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.German: Ich weiß nichts über die Liebe oder den Hass den Gott für euch hat, [CT_NAME], aber ich weiß dass ihr sterben werdet falls ihr das nicht an [OUR_CIV_SHORT] aushändigt.
TEXT.Italian: I know nothing about the love or hatred that God has for you, [CT_NAME], but I do know that you will all die if you don't hand this over to [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Spanish: No se nada sobre el amor ni el odio que Dios os tiene, [CT_NAME], pero s se que todos vosotros moriris si no entregais esto a [OUR_CIV_SHORT].

TEXT.English: I had a vision of the [CT_EMPIRE] going up in flames. Care to assure me that I was just crazy?
TEXT.French: I had a vision of the [CT_EMPIRE] going up in flames. Care to assure me that I was just crazy?
TEXT.German: Ich hatte die Vision, dass [CT_EMPIRE] in Flammen aufgehen wird. Macht es euch etwas aus mich zu vergewissern dass ich nur verrückt bin?
TEXT.Italian: I had a vision of the [CT_EMPIRE] going up in flames. Care to assure me that I was just crazy?
TEXT.Spanish: Tuve una visin del [CT_EMPIRE] prendindose en llamas. Os importara asegurarme de que slo era una locura ma?

TEXT.English: Greetings from [OUR_NAME] the Great, king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.French: Greetings from [OUR_NAME] the Great, king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.German: Grüße von [OUR_NAME] dem Großen, König von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Ich erwarte Jahre guter Beziehungen zwischen [OUR_EMPIRE] und [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings from [OUR_NAME] the Great, king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings from [OUR_NAME] the Great, king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! I expect years of good relations between the [OUR_EMPIRE] and the [CT_EMPIRE]!

TEXT.English: I am [OUR_NAME]. Will you help me make [OUR_CIV_SHORT] great?
TEXT.French: I am [OUR_NAME]. Will you help me make [OUR_CIV_SHORT] great?
TEXT.German: Ich bin [OUR_NAME]. Werdet ihr mir helfen [OUR_CIV_SHORT] zu Größe zu verhelfen?
TEXT.Italian: I am [OUR_NAME]. Will you help me make [OUR_CIV_SHORT] great?
TEXT.Spanish: I am [OUR_NAME]. Will you help me make [OUR_CIV_SHORT] great?

TEXT.English: Go away if you don't want me to get my sword!
TEXT.French: Go away if you don't want me to get my sword!
TEXT.German: Verschindet sofern ihr nicht wollt dass ich mein Schwert hole!
TEXT.Italian: Go away if you don't want me to get my sword!
TEXT.Spanish: Go away if you don't want me to get my sword!

TEXT.English: You do not deserve peace with [OUR_NAME] the Great!
TEXT.French: You do not deserve peace with [OUR_NAME] the Great!
TEXT.German: Ihr verdient keinen Frieden mit [OUR_NAME] dem Großen!
TEXT.Italian: You do not deserve peace with [OUR_NAME] the Great!
TEXT.Spanish: You do not deserve peace with [OUR_NAME] the Great!

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am so happy to see you here! Have you already seen the new castle I built?
TEXT.French: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am so happy to see you here! Have you already seen the new castle I built?
TEXT.German: Grüße, [CT_NAME]! Ich freue mich euch hier zu treffen! Habt ihr schon die neue Burg gesehen die ich errichten lies?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am so happy to see you here! Have you already seen the new castle I built?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am so happy to see you here! Have you already seen the new castle I built?

TEXT.English: Say what you have to say and try to give me a reason to listen to you!
TEXT.French: Say what you have to say and try to give me a reason to listen to you!
TEXT.German: Sagt was ihr zu sagen habt und gebt mir einen Grund euch zuzuhören!
TEXT.Italian: Say what you have to say and try to give me a reason to listen to you!
TEXT.Spanish: Say what you have to say and try to give me a reason to listen to you!

TEXT.English: Any chance [OUR_CIV_SHORT] can get help from [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Any chance [OUR_CIV_SHORT] can get help from [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: Gibt es eine Möglichkeit dass [OUR_CIV_SHORT] von [CT_NAME] Unterstützung erhält?
TEXT.Italian: Any chance [OUR_CIV_SHORT] can get help from [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Any chance [OUR_CIV_SHORT] can get help from [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT] today, so it won't destroy you tomorrow!
TEXT.French: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT] today, so it won't destroy you tomorrow!
TEXT.German: Helft [OUR_CIV_SHORT] heute und ihr werdet morgen nicht zerstört!
TEXT.Italian: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT] today, so it won't destroy you tomorrow!
TEXT.Spanish: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT] today, so it won't destroy you tomorrow!

TEXT.English: Give us this or prepare for war with the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.French: Give us this or prepare for war with the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.German: Gebt uns dieses oder bereitet euch auf Krieg mit [OUR_EMPIRE] vor!
TEXT.Italian: Give us this or prepare for war with the [OUR_EMPIRE]!
TEXT.Spanish: Give us this or prepare for war with the [OUR_EMPIRE]!

TEXT.English: Greetings! I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. Remember: they don't call me the "Lion of Lechistan" for no reason!
TEXT.French: Greetings! I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. Remember: they don't call me the "Lion of Lechistan" for no reason!
TEXT.German: Gegrüßt! Ich bin [OUR_NAME] von [OUR_EMPIRE]. Vergesst nicht: Man nennt mich nicht umsonst den "Löwen von Lechistan"!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings! I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. Remember: they don't call me the "Lion of Lechistan" for no reason!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings! I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. Remember: they don't call me the "Lion of Lechistan" for no reason!

TEXT.English: I am [OUR_NAME], King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania by the grace of God. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.French: I am [OUR_NAME], King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania by the grace of God. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.German: Ich bin John III. Sobieski, durch die Gnade Gottes König von Polen, Großfürst von Litauen. Ihr dürft meine Hand küssen.
TEXT.Italian: I am [OUR_NAME], King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania by the grace of God. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.Spanish: I am [OUR_NAME], King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania by the grace of God. You may kiss my hand.

TEXT.English: I do not wish to talk. You may send me a letter if you really want to.
TEXT.French: I do not wish to talk, but you may send me a letter.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte nicht reden, aber sendet mir doch einen Brief.
TEXT.Italian: I do not wish to talk, but you may send me a letter.
TEXT.Spanish: I do not wish to talk, but you may send me a letter.

TEXT.English: It is not possible to stop my hussars if they have already started charging.
TEXT.French: It is not possible to stop my hussars if they have already started charging.
TEXT.German: Es ist nicht möglich meine Husaren zu stoppen sobald sie losgestürmt sind.
TEXT.Italian: It is not possible to stop my hussars if they have already started charging.
TEXT.Spanish: It is not possible to stop my hussars if they have already started charging.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], my dear friend! What do you think about founding the Holy League?
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], my dear friend! What do you think about founding the Holy League?
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], mein lieber Freund! Was haltet ihr davon die Heilige Liga zu gründen?
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], my dear friend! What do you think about founding the Holy League?
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], my dear friend! What do you think about founding the Holy League?

TEXT.English: Have you ever heard the roar of a hundred charging knights? My hussars, be ready!
TEXT.French: Have you ever heard the roar of a hundred charging knights? My hussars, be ready!
TEXT.German: Habt ihr das Dröhnen hunderter angreifender Ritter gehört? Husaren seid bereit!
TEXT.Italian: Have you ever heard the roar of a hundred charging knights? My hussars, be ready!
TEXT.Spanish: Have you ever heard the roar of a hundred charging knights? My hussars, be ready!

TEXT.English: This will be the test of our friendship, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: This will be the test of our friendship, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Das ist eine Prüfung unserer Freundschaft, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: This will be the test of our friendship, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: This will be the test of our friendship, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: We need to help each other, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: We need to help each other, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Wir sollten und gegenseitig helfen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: We need to help each other, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: We need to help each other, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Do you really want me to start another crusade? My beloved Marysienka won't be happy.
TEXT.French: Do you really want me to start another crusade? My beloved Marysienka won't be happy.
TEXT.German: Wollt ihr wirklich dass ich einen weiteren Kreuzzug starte? Meine geliebte Marysienka wird nicht glücklich sein.
TEXT.Italian: Do you really want me to start another crusade? My beloved Marysienka won't be happy.
TEXT.Spanish: Do you really want me to start another crusade? My beloved Marysienka won't be happy.

TEXT.English: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.French: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.German: Um meinen heiligen Patron zu zitieren: Nichts in diesem unbeständigen Leben kann meinen Entschluss, Gott zu dienen, abschwächen.
TEXT.Italian: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.Spanish: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.

TEXT.English: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! Take a look around you and see the might of my empire!
TEXT.French: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! Take a look around you and see the might of my empire!
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, ich bin [OUR_NAME], Herrscher von [OUR_EMPIRE]! Schaut euch um und erkennt die Macht meines Reiches!
TEXT.Italian: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! Take a look around you and see the might of my empire!
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the [OUR_EMPIRE]! Take a look around you and see the might of my empire!

TEXT.English: I do not speak to those who are disloyal to me! Go away I said!
TEXT.French: I do not speak to those who are disloyal to me! Go away I said!
TEXT.German: Ich spreche nicht mit denjenigen, die mir gegenüber treulos sind. Geht weg, hab ich gesagt!
TEXT.Italian: I do not speak to those who are disloyal to me! Go away I said!
TEXT.Spanish: I do not speak to those who are disloyal to me! Go away I said!

TEXT.English: So, you want peace? No, you'll have to beat me first! Good luck, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.French: So, you want peace? No, you'll have to beat me first! Good luck, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Ihr wollt also Frieden? Nein, ihr müsst mich erst besiegen! Viel Glück, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Italian: So, you want peace? No, you'll have to beat me first! Good luck, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Spanish: So, you want peace? No, you'll have to beat me first! Good luck, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: Oh, hello, [CT_NAME]! Welcome again to my glorious lands! Do you have any daughters my sons can marry?
TEXT.French: Oh, hello, [CT_NAME]! Welcome again to my glorious lands! Do you have any daughters my sons can marry?
TEXT.German: Oh, seid gegrüßt [CT_NAME]! Willkommen in meinem glorreichen Land! Habt ihr irgendwelche Töchter die meine Söhne heiraten könnten?
TEXT.Italian: Oh, hello, [CT_NAME]! Welcome again to my glorious lands! Do you have any daughters my sons can marry?
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, hello, [CT_NAME]! Welcome again to my glorious lands! Do you have any daughters my sons can marry?

TEXT.English: Speak faster, [CT_NAME], I have no time for the likes of you. My laws won't write themselves, you know!
TEXT.French: Speak faster, [CT_NAME], I have no time for the likes of you. My laws won't write themselves, you know!
TEXT.German: Sprecht schneller,[CT_NAME]. Ich habe keine Zeit für euresgleichen. Meine Gesetze schreiben sich nicht von selbst, wisst ihr.
TEXT.Italian: Speak faster, [CT_NAME], I have no time for the likes of you. My laws won't write themselves, you know!
TEXT.Spanish: Speak faster, [CT_NAME], I have no time for the likes of you. My laws won't write themselves, you know!

TEXT.English: As a patron of learning, I'd like some help from you to educate my society. Do we have a deal?
TEXT.French: As a patron of learning, I'd like some help from you to educate my society. Do we have a deal?
TEXT.German: Als Förderer des Wissen würde ich gerne diese Hilfe von euch in Anspruch nehmen um mein Volk auszubilden. Schlagt ihr ein?
TEXT.Italian: As a patron of learning, I'd like some help from you to educate my society. Do we have a deal?
TEXT.Spanish: As a patron of learning, I'd like some help from you to educate my society. Do we have a deal?

TEXT.English: If you don't want to make me mad I suggest you give me this. You don't want to spoil our relations, do you?
TEXT.French: If you don't want to make me mad I suggest you give me this. You don't want to spoil our relations, do you?
TEXT.German: Wenn ihr mich nicht ärgern wollt, dann schlage ich vor ihr gebt mir dies. Ihr wollt unsere Beziehungen doch nicht verderben, oder?
TEXT.Italian: If you don't want to make me mad I suggest you give me this. You don't want to spoil our relations, do you?
TEXT.Spanish: If you don't want to make me mad I suggest you give me this. You don't want to spoil our relations, do you?

TEXT.English: I suggest you give us this if you don't want to spend the rest of your life imprisoned like my brother...
TEXT.French: I suggest you give us this if you don't want to spend the rest of your life imprisoned like my brother...
TEXT.German: Ich schlage vor ihr gebt uns dies, wenn ihr nicht den Rest eures Leben eingekerkert sein wollt wie mein Bruder...
TEXT.Italian: I suggest you give us this if you don't want to spend the rest of your life imprisoned like my brother...
TEXT.Spanish: I suggest you give us this if you don't want to spend the rest of your life imprisoned like my brother...

TEXT.English: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am the great [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people, inhabitants of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.French: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am the great [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people, inhabitants of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.German: Ich bin geehrt euch zu treffen, [CT_NAME]. Ich bin der große [OUR_NAME] vom [OUR_CIV_ADJ] Volk, Bewohner von [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Italian: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am the great [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people, inhabitants of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Spanish: I am honored to meet you, [CT_NAME]. I am the great [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people, inhabitants of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].

TEXT.English: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], czar of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Do you want to discover why they call me the Terrible?
TEXT.French: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], czar of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Do you want to discover why they call me the Terrible?
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüt, [CT_NAME]. Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Zar von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Willst Du wissen warum ich "der Schreckliche" genannt werde?
TEXT.Italian: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME], czar of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Do you want to discover why they call me the Terrible?
TEXT.Spanish: Hola, [CT_NAME]. Soy [OUR_NAME], el zar de [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Queres saber por qu me llaman "El Terrible."?

TEXT.English: Two Romes have fallen but the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.French: Two Romes have fallen but the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.German: Zwei Roms sind gefallen aber ein Drittes existiert, und es wird kein Viertes geben.
TEXT.Italian: Two Romes have fallen but the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.Spanish: Two Romes have fallen but the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.

TEXT.English: No! I absolutely refuse to speak with you!
TEXT.French: No! I absolutely refuse to speak with you!
TEXT.German: Nein! Ich lehne es strikt ab mit euch zu sprechen!
TEXT.Italian: No! I absolutely refuse to speak with you!
TEXT.Spanish: No! I absolutely refuse to speak with you!

TEXT.English: You stinky dog! Go away!
TEXT.French: You stinky dog! Go away!
TEXT.German: Ihr seid ein räudiger Hund! Verschwindet!
TEXT.Italian: You stinky dog! Go away!
TEXT.Spanish: Perro apestoso! Largaos!

TEXT.English: This war won't end until you and your entire army will be sitting in my court... impaled on poles!
TEXT.French: This war won't end until you and your entire army will be sitting in my court... impaled on poles!
TEXT.German: Dieser Krieg wird nicht enden bevor ihr und euer gesamtes Heer in meinem Hof sitzen werdet... aufgespießt auf Pfählen!
TEXT.Italian: This war won't end until you and your entire army will be sitting in my court... impaled on poles!
TEXT.Spanish: Esta guerra no terminar hasta que vos y todo vuestro ejrcito estn sentados en mi corte... empalados en mis estacas!

TEXT.English: Certainly not. The war will continue until I decide it is time to resume peace, or you are conquered!
TEXT.French: Certainement pas. La guerre continuera jusqu'à la victoire totale.
TEXT.German: Auf keinen Fall! Der Krieg wird so lange fortgeführt, bis wir den vollständigen Sieg erzielt haben!
TEXT.Italian: Certo che no. La guerra continuerà fino a quando non avremo ottenuto una vittoria totale.
TEXT.Spanish: Por supuesto que no. La guerra seguirá hasta que hayamos logrado la victoria total.

TEXT.English: Oh, [CT_NAME]! Wait a second... I'll finish torturing this basurman and I'll be with you!
TEXT.French: Oh, [CT_NAME]! Wait a second... I'll finish torturing this basurman and I'll be with you!
TEXT.German: Oh, [CT_NAME]! Wartet einen Moment... Ich beende noch die Folter dieses Muselmannes dann kümmere ich mich um euch!
TEXT.Italian: Oh, [CT_NAME]! Wait a second... I'll finish torturing this basurman and I'll be with you!
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, [CT_NAME]! Esperad un segundo... dejadme terminar de torturar a este basurman y luego os atiendo.

TEXT.English: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. I can always spare a few moments to converse with friends and allies.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, [CT_NAME]. Je suis toujours disponible pour discuter avec mes amis et alliés.
TEXT.German: Willkommen, [CT_NAME]. Für Freunde und Verbündete habe ich immer ein paar Minuten Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: Benvenuto, [CT_NAME]. Ho sempre un momento da dedicare ad amici e alleati.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. Siempre tengo un momento libre para charlar con amigos y aliados como vos.

TEXT.English: Right on time, [CT_NAME]! I have prepared a pole just for you!
TEXT.French: Right on time, [CT_NAME]! I have prepared a pole just for you!
TEXT.German: Zur rechten Zeit, [CT_NAME]! Ich habe extra für euch einen Pfahl aufgestellt!
TEXT.Italian: Right on time, [CT_NAME]! I have prepared a pole just for you!
TEXT.Spanish: Os doy la bienvenida, [CT_NAME], He preparado una estaca solo para vos!

TEXT.English: Can you spare us this, [CT_NAME]? I would be extremely grateful for your assistance.
TEXT.French: Pouvez-vous nous donner ceci, [CT_NAME] ? Je vous serais extrêmement reconnaissant de votre aide.
TEXT.German: Könnt Ihr das hier erübrigen, [CT_NAME]? Ich wäre Euch wirklich außerordentlich verbunden.
TEXT.Italian: Puoi darci ciò che chiediamo, [CT_NAME]? Sarei molto riconoscente per la tua assistenza.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Podrías darnos esto, [CT_NAME]? Os estaríamos tremendamente agradecidos por vuestra ayuda.

TEXT.English: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] could use this, you know?
TEXT.French: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] could use this, you know?
TEXT.German: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] kann das gebrauchen.
TEXT.Italian: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] could use this, you know?
TEXT.Spanish: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] poda utilizar esto, sabis?

TEXT.English: It would be diplomatically expedient to give us what we want, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Il serait diplomatiquement opportun de nous donner ce que nous voulons, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Es wäre in diplomatischer Hinsicht durchaus angebracht, unsere Forderung zu erfüllen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Sarebbe diplomaticamente vantaggioso darci ciò che vogliamo, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: ¿No sería más oportuno, diplomáticamente hablando, que nos dierais lo que queremos, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Peace is the biggest struggle. Time to pay up, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Peace is the biggest struggle. Time to pay up, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Friede ist die größte Anstrengung. Zeit zum Zahlen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Peace is the biggest struggle. Time to pay up, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Peace is the biggest struggle. Time to pay up, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Give me this or be impaled!
TEXT.French: Give me this or be impaled!
TEXT.German: Gebt mir das oder werdet gepfählt!
TEXT.Italian: Give me this or be impaled!
TEXT.Spanish: Dadme sto o seris empalado!

TEXT.English: Pay your debts, dog!
TEXT.French: Pay your debts, dog!
TEXT.German: Zahlt eure Schulden, Hund!
TEXT.Italian: Pay your debts, dog!
TEXT.Spanish: Pagad vuestras deudas, perro!

TEXT.English: Greetings from the great king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace and an alliance with us or demand war?
TEXT.French: Greetings from the great king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace and an alliance with us or demand war?
TEXT.German: Grüße vom großen König von [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [OUR_NAME]! Sucht ihr Frieden und wollt euch mit uns verbünden oder fordert ihr Krieg?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings from the great king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace and an alliance with us or demand war?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings from the great king of [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [OUR_NAME]! Are you looking for peace and an alliance with us or demand war?

TEXT.English: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.French: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.German: Gott ist mein Schild!
TEXT.Italian: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.Spanish: The Lord God is my armor!

TEXT.English: I don't speak to traitors!
TEXT.French: I don't speak to traitors!
TEXT.German: Ich rede nicht mit Verrätern!
TEXT.Italian: I don't speak to traitors!
TEXT.Spanish: I don't speak to traitors!

TEXT.English: Peace, [CT_NAME]?! I'm not done with you yet!
TEXT.French: Peace, [CT_NAME]?! I'm not done with you yet!
TEXT.German: Friede, [CT_NAME]?! Ich bin mit euch noch nicht fertig!
TEXT.Italian: Peace, [CT_NAME]?! I'm not done with you yet!
TEXT.Spanish: Peace, [CT_NAME]?! I'm not done with you yet!

TEXT.English: Welcome again! I will show you how the restoration of my castle is going.
TEXT.French: Welcome again! I will show you how the restoration of my castle is going.
TEXT.German: Nochmals willkommen! Ich zeige euch Fortschritt des Wiederaufbaus meiner Burg.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome again! I will show you how the restoration of my castle is going.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome again! I will show you how the restoration of my castle is going.

TEXT.English: Well, if it isn't [CT_NAME]... What is that you want from the great [OUR_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Well, if it isn't [CT_NAME]... What is that you want from the great [OUR_NAME]?
TEXT.German: Nun falls es das nicht ist [CT_NAME]... Was möchtet ihr vom großen [OUR_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Well, if it isn't [CT_NAME]... What is that you want from the great [OUR_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Well, if it isn't [CT_NAME]... What is that you want from the great [OUR_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME], and we will be grateful!
TEXT.French: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME], and we will be grateful!
TEXT.German: Helft [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME], und wir werden dankbar sein!
TEXT.Italian: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME], and we will be grateful!
TEXT.Spanish: Help [OUR_CIV_SHORT], [CT_NAME], and we will be grateful!

TEXT.English: So, any chance you will share the following with your allies, the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1]?
TEXT.French: So, any chance you will share the following with your allies, the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1]?
TEXT.German: Gibt es eine Möglichkeit dass ihr folgendes mit eurem Verbündeten, den [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1], teilt?
TEXT.Italian: So, any chance you will share the following with your allies, the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1]?
TEXT.Spanish: So, any chance you will share the following with your allies, the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1]?

TEXT.English: [OUR_NAME] demands this! Do not test his patience!
TEXT.French: [OUR_NAME] demands this! Do not test his patience!
TEXT.German: [OUR_NAME] fordert dies! Stellt seine Geduld nicht auf die Probe!
TEXT.Italian: [OUR_NAME] demands this! Do not test his patience!
TEXT.Spanish: [OUR_NAME] demands this! Do not test his patience!

TEXT.English: I am [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Welcome to my kingdom, [CT_NAME]. It is through divine will that I am here before you; to what do YOU owe your presence before me?
TEXT.French: I am [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Welcome to my kingdom, [CT_NAME]. It is through divine will that I am here before you; to what do YOU owe your presence before me?
TEXT.German: Ich bin [OUR_NAME] von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Willkommen in meinem Königreich, [CT_NAME]. Es ist der göttliche Wille dass ich vor Euch hier bin; wem verdankt IHR eure Anwesenheit vor mir?
TEXT.Italian: I am [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Welcome to my kingdom, [CT_NAME]. It is through divine will that I am here before you; to what do YOU owe your presence before me?
TEXT.Spanish: I am [OUR_NAME] of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]! Welcome to my kingdom, [CT_NAME]. It is through divine will that I am here before you; to what do YOU owe your presence before me?

TEXT.English: If you associate with wise men, you will become wise; if you deal with fools, you will become one of them. So, [CT_NAME], are you that wise that you come in peace?
TEXT.French: If you associate with wise men, you will become wise; if you deal with fools, you will become one of them. So, [CT_NAME], are you that wise that you come in peace?
TEXT.German: Wenn man sich mit den Weisen abgibt, so wird man selbst auch weise; wenn man sich mit Dummköpfen beschäftigt, wird man einer von ihnen. Also, [CT_NAME], seid Ihr so weise, dass Ihr in Frieden kommt?
TEXT.Italian: Se tu frequenti uomini saggi, anche tu lo diventerai; se hai a che fare con gli stupidi, diventerai uno di loro; Quindi, [CT_NAME], sei tu uno di quei saggi che vengono qui in pace?
TEXT.Spanish: If you associate with wise men, you will become wise; if you deal with fools, you will become one of them. So, [CT_NAME], are you that wise that you come in peace?

TEXT.English: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.French: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.German: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.Italian: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.Spanish: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.

TEXT.English: Insubordination is a pestilence in the kingdom. I have nothing to say to you.
TEXT.French: Insubordination is a pestilence in the kingdom. I have nothing to say to you.
TEXT.German: Ungehorsamkeit ist wahrlich eine Pest im gesamten Königreich. Ich habe Euch nichts zu sagen.
TEXT.Italian: L'insubordinazione è come una pestilenza per il regno. Io non ho niente da dirti.
TEXT.Spanish: Insubordination is a pestilence in the kingdom. I have nothing to say to you.

TEXT.English: Don't come back until you've converted, you pagan son of a badger!
TEXT.French: Don't come back until you've converted, you pagan son of a badger!
TEXT.German: Don't come back until you've converted, you pagan son of a badger!
TEXT.Italian: Don't come back until you've converted, you pagan son of a badger!
TEXT.Spanish: Don't come back until you've converted, you pagan son of a badger!

TEXT.English: A patient king reigns, but an impatient king is a tyrant. We can not have peace with tyrants.
TEXT.French: A patient king reigns, but an impatient king is a tyrant. We can not have peace with tyrants.
TEXT.German: Geduldige Könige herrschen, ungeduldige jedoch tyrannisieren. Mit Tyrannen können wir keinen Frieden schließen!
TEXT.Italian: I re pazienti regnano, gli impazienti tiranneggiano. Coi tiranni noi non facciamo pace!
TEXT.Spanish: A patient king reigns, but an impatient king is a tyrant. We can not have peace with tyrants.

TEXT.English: Talk to the Holy Right, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.French: Talk to the Holy Right, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Talk to the Holy Right, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Italian: Talk to the Holy Right, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.Spanish: Talk to the Holy Right, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: Here comes my best friend, [CT_NAME]! What brings you today to [OUR_CIV_SHORT]?

TEXT.English: You know, I almost feel sorry for [CT_CIV_SHORT], having of all people you as their leader. What is it you want to talk about?

TEXT.English: Would you like to take part in this deal with [OUR_EMPIRE]? It's not like you have much choice anyway.

TEXT.English: We demand your assistance, [CT_NAME]! [OUR_CIV_SHORT]'s future depends on you!

TEXT.English: If you don't give me this, you're asking me to engage you in personal combat. Believe me, that is not a good idea.

TEXT.English: Hand this over, or I'll have to call ten men over here to bring me my sword!

TEXT.English: Recognizing me as king of the [OUR_EMPIRE] is not enough! I demand the following in tribute!

TEXT.English: Hail and well met, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], ruler of the glorious [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. So tell me: does [CT_CIV_SHORT] have a lot of rich and unprotected coastal cities, or what?
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME], c'est un vrai plaisir ! Je suis [OUR_NAME], chef des glorieux [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dites-moi : est-ce que [CT_CIV_SHORT] dispose de nombreuses villes côtières riches et faiblement protégées ?
TEXT.German: Tag auch, [CT_NAME]! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Staatsoberhaupt des ruhmreichen Volkes von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Nun, dann erzählt mal: Besitzt Ihr vielleicht ein paar reiche, schutzlose Küstenstädte?
TEXT.Italian: Salute a te, [CT_NAME]! Io sono [OUR_NAME], glorioso sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ]. Parliamo, dunque: [CT_CIV_SHORT] ha molte città costiere ricche e poco protette, vero?
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos y bienaventuranzas, [CT_NAME]. Soy [OUR_NAME], dirigente de la gloriosa tierra de [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Decidme, ¿tiene o no [CT_CIV_SHORT] muchas ciudades costeras prósperas e indefensas?

TEXT.English: Greetings from the [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] of the ancient north! Shall we live in peace or do you wish to challenge us?
